body_content.explanation: an deciduous tree (= a tree that loses its leaves in autumn and grows new ones in the spring) that is part of the mahogany family and produces a small, yellow fruit. It has its origin in Asia and grows in the southern United States:
examples: Some homeowners find a Chinaberry to be an annoyance because of the berries that litter the ground beneath it.
The sheep developed an appetite for invasive plants such as privet and chinaberry.
